  • Chapter 1: Setting Up
  • Codegen Module

Setting up the use of this module.

  • §1. Introduction
  • §2. Setting up the memory manager
  • §4. The beginning
  • §5. The end

§1. Introduction. 

    define CODEGEN_MODULE TRUE

§2. Setting up the memory manager. We need to itemise the structures we'll want to allocate: 

    enum I6T_intervention_MT
    enum stage_set_MT
    enum stage_step_MT
    enum uniqueness_count_MT
    enum text_literal_holder_MT
    enum inter_schema_MT
    enum inter_schema_node_MT
    enum inter_schema_token_MT

§3. With allocation functions: 

    ALLOCATE_INDIVIDUALLY(I6T_intervention)
    ALLOCATE_INDIVIDUALLY(stage_set)
    ALLOCATE_INDIVIDUALLY(stage_step)
    ALLOCATE_INDIVIDUALLY(uniqueness_count)
    ALLOCATE_INDIVIDUALLY(text_literal_holder)
    ALLOCATE_INDIVIDUALLY(inter_schema)
    ALLOCATE_INDIVIDUALLY(inter_schema_node)
    ALLOCATE_INDIVIDUALLY(inter_schema_token)

§4. The beginning. (The client doesn't need to call the start and end routines, because the foundation module does that automatically.) 

    void CodegenModule::start(void) {
        <Register this module's memory allocation reasons 4.2>;
        <Register this module's stream writers 4.3>;
        <Register this module's debugging log aspects 4.5>;
        <Register this module's debugging log writers 4.6>;
        <Register this module's command line switches 4.7>;
    }

The function CodegenModule::start appears nowhere else.

§4.1. 

    enum CODE_GENERATION_MREASON

§4.2. <Register this module's memory allocation reasons 4.2> = 

        Memory::reason_name(CODE_GENERATION_MREASON, "code generation workspace for objects");

This code is used in §4.

§4.3. <Register this module's stream writers 4.3> = 

        ;

This code is used in §4.

§4.4. 

    enum TEMPLATE_READING_DA
    enum RESOLVING_CONDITIONAL_COMPILATION_DA
    enum EXTERNAL_SYMBOL_RESOLUTION_DA
    enum SCHEMA_COMPILATION_DA
    enum SCHEMA_COMPILATION_DETAILS_DA

§4.5. <Register this module's debugging log aspects 4.5> = 

        Log::declare_aspect(TEMPLATE_READING_DA, L"template reading", FALSE, FALSE);
        Log::declare_aspect(RESOLVING_CONDITIONAL_COMPILATION_DA, L"resolving conditional compilation", FALSE, FALSE);
        Log::declare_aspect(EXTERNAL_SYMBOL_RESOLUTION_DA, L"external symbol resolution", FALSE, FALSE);
        Log::declare_aspect(SCHEMA_COMPILATION_DA, L"schema compilation", FALSE, FALSE);
        Log::declare_aspect(SCHEMA_COMPILATION_DETAILS_DA, L"schema compilation details", FALSE, FALSE);

This code is used in §4.

§4.6. <Register this module's debugging log writers 4.6> = 

        ;

This code is used in §4.

§4.7. <Register this module's command line switches 4.7> = 

        ;

This code is used in §4.

§5. The end. 

    void CodegenModule::end(void) {
    }

The function CodegenModule::end appears nowhere else.
